body_html: If I've already called backward on the local process and I don't need to keep the autograd computational graph nor the threads it has open, is there some way I can "turn off" the autograd engine before I launch subprocesses that call backward and therefore be able to fork safely?

body: If I've already called `backward` on the local process and I don't need to keep the `autograd` computational graph nor the threads it has open, is there some way I can "turn off" the autograd engine before I launch subprocesses that call `backward` and therefore be able to fork safely?
